rules.overviewText: In the game Love Letter, players take on the role of potential suitors seeking to deliver their love letter to the Princess. The player whose letter reaches the princess wins her heart and the game.
rules.gameplayText: Players take turns clockwise around the table. On your turn: 1. Draw the top card from the deck. 2. Choose one of your two cards to play and place it face-up in front of you. 3. Follow the instructions on the played card. 4. After playing a card, if you are still in the round, you should have exactly one card in hand.
rules.endOfRoundText: A round ends when: - The deck is empty after a player's turn. - All players except one are out of the round. The player still in the round or the player with the highest-value card wins the round and receives a token of affection.
rules.winningGameText: The first player to collect a certain number of tokens (depending on the number of players) wins the game.
rules.princessDescription: If you discard this card, you are out of the round.
rules.countessDescription: If you have this card and the King or Prince in your hand, you must discard this card.
rules.kingDescription: Trade hands with another player of your choice.
rules.chancellorDescription: Draw two additional cards from the deck, choose one of them to keep and return the other two to the bottom of the deck.
rules.princeDescription: Choose any player (including yourself) to discard their hand and draw a new card.
rules.handmaidDescription: Until your next turn, you are immune to the effects of other players' cards.
rules.baronDescription: Compare hands with another player. The player with the lower-value card is out of the round.
rules.guardDescription: Name a card (except Guard). If another player has that card, they are out of the round.
rules.spyDescription: If you are the only non-eliminated player at the end of the round who played it, you get an extra point (even if you didn't win the round).
